name: BlockStateHelper
description: The `BlockStateHelper` class is a comprehensive helper class in JSMacros that provides access to Minecraft block state information and functionality.
overview:
The `BlockStateHelper` class is a comprehensive helper class in JSMacros that provides access to Minecraft block state information and functionality. It acts as a wrapper around Minecraft's `BlockState` class, exposing various properties and methods that allow script developers to interact with and analyze block states in the game world.

This class is particularly useful for World Interaction scripts where you need to examine blocks, check their properties, determine their behavior, or make decisions based on block characteristics.

methods.name: toMap
methods.description: Returns a map of all state properties with their identifiers and values

methods.name: with
methods.description: Creates a new block state with the specified property set to the given value

methods.name: getRaw
methods.description: Returns the underlying Minecraft BlockState object

methods.name: hashCode
methods.description: Returns the hash code of the underlying block state

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Compares this block state with another object

methods.name: getBlock
methods.description: Returns the block that this state belongs to.

methods.name: getId
methods.description: Returns the block's registry ID.

methods.name: getHardness
methods.description: Returns the hardness of the block, which affects how long it takes to mine.

methods.name: getLuminance
methods.description: Returns the light level emitted by this block state (0-15).

methods.name: isOpaque
methods.description: Returns true if the block is opaque (light cannot pass through).

methods.name: isSolid
methods.description: Returns true if the block is solid (entities cannot pass through).

methods.name: blocksMovement
methods.description: Returns true if the state blocks the movement of entities.

methods.name: isAir
methods.description: Returns true if the state represents air.

methods.name: isLiquid
methods.description: Returns true if the state represents a liquid block.

methods.name: isBurnable
methods.description: Returns true if the block can be burned by fire.

methods.name: isReplaceable
methods.description: Returns true if the block can be replaced without breaking it first. This applies to blocks like air, grass, and tall grass.

methods.name: emitsRedstonePower
methods.description: Returns true if the block state emits redstone power.

methods.name: hasComparatorOutput
methods.description: Returns true if the block can produce a comparator output.

methods.name: getPistonBehaviour
methods.description:
Returns the piston behavior of the block as a string. Possible values:
- "NORMAL" - Can be pushed and pulled by pistons
- "BLOCK" - Blocks piston movement but can be pushed
- "PUSH_ONLY" - Can only be pushed, not pulled
- "DESTROY" - Will be destroyed by pistons
- "IGNORE" - Completely ignored by pistons

methods.name: isToolRequired
methods.description: Returns true if a specific tool is required to mine this block efficiently.

methods.name: getFluidState
methods.description: Returns the fluid state of this block state (for blocks containing fluids).

methods.name: hasBlockEntity
methods.description: Returns true if the block has an associated block entity (like chests, furnaces, etc.).

methods.name: hasRandomTicks
methods.description: Returns true if the block can receive random ticks (used for crops, redstone components, etc.).

methods.name: allowsSpawning
methods.description: Returns true if the specified entity type can spawn on this block state at the given position.

methods.name: shouldSuffocate
methods.description: Returns true if an entity would suffocate in this block state at the given position.

methods.name: getUniversal
methods.description: Returns a `UniversalBlockStateHelper` that provides access to all possible block properties, including those specific to certain block types.
